New Records: Anthony Volpe became the first player in World Series history to hit a grand slam and steal two bases in the same game.
Freddie Freeman became the first player to homer in the first four games of a World Series.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe's grand slam in the third inning sparked the Yankees' comeback.
Freddie Freeman's home run in the first inning extended his streak to six consecutive World Series games.
The game went into extra innings as the Yankees avoided a series sweep.
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees were trailing 0-2 after the first inning.
The Dodgers were aiming to secure a 3-0 series lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
Anthony Volpe reflected on the significance of the win for himself and his family.
Freddie Freeman commented on his home run streak.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Yankee Stadium with a sellout crowd.
The Yankees' bullpen performed effectively in relief.
The victory prevented the Yankees from their first losing World Series sweep since 1976.
